stimulusHtml: A resistor is connected to a variable source of potential difference. A group of students take measurements of the potential difference ΔV across and current in a resistor for different settings of the source of potential difference. A graph of the students’ data is shown in the figure. Which of the following will best determine the resistance of the resistor?
choicesHtml: Calculate the area under a best-fit line between the lowest and highest ΔV values.
Calculate the areas under line segments that connect adjacent data points. Add the areas together.
Calculate the slope of a best-fit line to the data. Take the inverse of the slope.
Calculate the slope of the line connecting the points with the lowest and highest ΔV values. Take the inverse of the slope.
